course_title: Critical Writing in Hispanic Topics: Education,Community,and Nation

class_notes:
CONTENT: This course teaches critical reading and writing skills while exploring the topic of education in specific national and community contexts. The class will study fiction, essays, and film from Galicia (Spain), Chile, and the Maya world, with an eye to how each place's historical debates inform current conditions. Students will also research education in other areas of the Spanish-speaking world.
EVALUATION: Evaluation is based on active engagement, weekly writing assignments, short essays, a research project, and in-class presentations. 
PREREQUISITE: SPAN 212 or an Official Spanish Placement into our Foundational Course level (Span 300-318). Take the online Spanish Placement Exam at http://spanport.emory.edu/home/undergraduate/placement/index.html.
course_description: This course combines advanced writing instruction with the study of diverse Hispanic cultural topics.
